recoil.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to move back suddenly and quickly from something you do not like or are afraid of
recoil.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She recoiled from his touch as if she had been slapped.
recoil.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to feel such a strong dislike of a particular situation that you want to avoid it
recoil.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We recoil in horror from the thought of subjecting someone to extreme pain.
He recoils from everything in life that demands hard work.
recoil.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if a gun recoils, it moves backwards very quickly after it has been fired
